original_title: Sri Lankan father-son duo dead after drowning at waterfall in Australia
original_body_lines: Two Sri Lankans have died in Australia after drowning in a popular swimming hole while on holiday in the far north of Queensland state, foreign media reported.
The deceased were identified as a father-son duo, aged 59 and 21 years.
While holidaying in Queensland, they had visited the Crystal Cascades waterfall with a group of tourists.
The waterfall, a popular tourist spot located in Cairns, is known for its slippery rocks and strong currents, according to Australian media.
The father, who was bathing in the water, was first swept away by strong currents. His son and daughter then attempted to rescue him, only to get caught in currents.
Emergency services rushed to the scene, after receiving reports of the trio struggling to get out of the water.
Shortly after being rescued, the unresponsive father and the son were declared dead shortly.
Queensland Police have confirmed that there were no suspicious circumstances surrounding the deaths.
